author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: “Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo anāgāmiphalaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t realize the fruit of non-return.

segments.pli: Assaddhiyaṃ, ahirikaṃ, anottappaṃ, kosajjaṃ, muṭṭhassaccaṃ, duppaññataṃ—
segments.en: Lack of faith, conscience, and prudence; laziness, unmindfulness, and witlessness.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme appahāya abhabbo anāgāmiphalaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
segments.en: Without giving up these six things you can’t realize the fruit of non-return.

segments.pli: Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo anāgāmiphalaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
segments.en: After giving up six things you can realize the fruit of non-return.

segments.pli: Assaddhiyaṃ, ahirikaṃ, anottappaṃ, kosajjaṃ, muṭṭhassaccaṃ, duppaññataṃ—
segments.en: Lack of faith, conscience, and prudence; laziness, unmindfulness, and witlessness.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme pahāya bhabbo anāgāmiphalaṃ sacchikātun”ti.
segments.en: After giving up these six things you can realize the fruit of non-return.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t realize…
